CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 4 reads: "Danettes Back NAACP - Members of the Danettes Club, organized last year for the specific purpose of raising funds for the NAACP, present to Atty. Byrd Brown, president of the local branch, a pledge for $4,500, which eventually will entitle each of the nine members to a life membership. This puts the group in a class by itself, because most organizations take out only a single $500 membership.  Left to right, seated: Gladys Brown and Martha Loper.  Standing: Gladys Lawson, Emily Brisett, Ida Jones, president; Attorney Brown, Clozelle Peterson and Florence Hutchison. - Harris Photo
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Danettes Club members, seated, left to right: Gladys Brown and Martha Loper; standing: Gladys Lawson, Emily Brisett, Ida Jones, handing check for NAACP to Attorney Byrd Brown, Clozelle Peterson, and Florence Hutchison, gathered in Loendi Club, another version
